titles.title: The Winds and Billows Loudly Roar

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: The winds and billows loudly roar We flounder in the deep Our bark is frail, far off the shore, And Jesus is asleep.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: "Save us, we perish, Lord," they cry; To Thee we fly for aid; "Awake! awake!" they say; but why So faithless and afraid?

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: His head is pillow'd on the stern, As Man He is asleep; As God He all things does discern, And endless vigils keep.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: He does the elements control; By His Almighty Will. The angry waves their surges roll; And at His Word are still.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: O ye, who in the Church's Bark O'er life's rough ocean sail, When all around is drear and dark, and human efforts fail,
